pullRequest.title: HIVE-23671: MSCK repair should handle transactional tables
pullRequest.bodyText:
NOTICE
Please create an issue in ASF JIRA before opening a pull request,
and you need to set the title of the pull request which starts with
the corresponding JIRA issue number. (e.g. HIVE-XXXXX: Fix a typo in YYY)
For more details, please see https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/Hive/HowToContribute

commit.message: HIVE-23671: MSCK repair should handle transactional tables

nodes.bodyText: redundant check (sessionTxnMgr != null), see if condition above
i think it can't be null, it returns ThreadLocal variable
is it ever a valid condition?
could you extend TestTxnCommands2 from TxnCommandsBaseForTests and remove static?
move RowComp from TestTxnCommands2 to TxnCommandsBaseForTests
why not setIntVar?
could you please move helper methods at the bottom of the Test class after all tests
weird mix of Camel case and underscore
should we answer this question in a current patch?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -111,24 +120,24 @@ public IMetaStoreClient getMsc() {
    * @param partitions
    *          List of partition name value pairs, if null or empty check all
    *          partitions
-   * @param table
-   * @param result
-   *          Fill this with the results of the check
+   * @param table Table we want to run the check for.
+   * @return Results of the check
    * @throws MetastoreException
    *           Failed to get required information from the metastore.
    * @throws IOException
    *           Most likely filesystem related
    */
-  public void checkMetastore(String catName, String dbName, String tableName,
-      List<? extends Map<String, String>> partitions, Table table, CheckResult result)
+  public CheckResult checkMetastore(String catName, String dbName, String tableName,
+      List<? extends Map<String, String>> partitions, Table table)
       throws MetastoreException, IOException {
-
+    CheckResult result = new CheckResult();
     if (dbName == null || "".equalsIgnoreCase(dbName)) {
       dbName = Warehouse.DEFAULT_DATABASE_NAME;
     }
 
     try {
       if (tableName == null || "".equals(tableName)) {
+        // TODO: I do not think this is used by anything other than tests

nodes.bodyText: why not use rest.split('_')?
why not use regex with pattern matching? removeVisibilityTxnId probably wouldn't even be needed
you can remove 1 nesting level
not formatted

you can do success &= writeResultToFile(msckInfo, result, repairOutput, partitionExpirySeconds)
for readability
same  success &= closeTxn(qualifiedTableName, success, txnId)
should we use error level here?
error level?
why calling log.info so many times?
should we pass already sorted collection here? it's a bad practice to mutate object parameters in a method.
error level?
why not use  try-with-resources?
could we move error messages to final variables (constants)?
what if we would like to ship FS deltas to the backup HMS due to some replication issue? could you please elaborate what issues do you see in increasing writeId in HMS to match FS?
why  not to log content of addMsgs
minor: i would probably create EnumMap for SEED_FN, and use proper one based on db type.
should we have a query constant?
what to rollback, you have select here?
lockInternal is required for Derby to simulate S4U, why use here? unlockInternal is not needed as well
minor: i would use try-with-resources instead of doing explicit management
minor: you can simply pass params as  Arrays.asList(rqst.getDbName(), rqst.getTableName()) instead of using so many local vars
not sure why is it used here

not quite understand this if condition. You have check in validateAndAddMaxTxnIdAndWriteId() if there are already some write ids registered in HMS and we try to do repair - throw exception. Could it be possible due to lack of locking that when we calculate the write ids there is nothing in HMS,  however when we try to seed - some transaction generates a new write id - would it cause some dataloss problems or other issues?

commit.message:
Merge remote-tracking branch 'origin/master' into HIVE-23671-msck-repair-2

# Conflicts:
#	ql/src/java/org/apache/hadoop/hive/ql/ddl/misc/msck/MsckOperation.java

#	standalone-metastore/metastore-server/src/main/java/org/apache/hadoop/hive/metastore/HiveMetaStoreChecker.java
